text: - [Instructor] In this course,

you'll learn how to build
a fullstack application
with AWS Amplify Studio.
We'll build a notes app

which has authentication,
authorization, and data.

We'll also use Amplify Studio's
Figma to code generation

to go straight from
design to React component.
If you're a front end developer

who wants to build a
fullstack application,
you're in the right place.
Some prerequisites are knowledge of React,

including state, event
listeners, and props,
how to use your computer CLI,
though we'll only use this a little bit,
so you don't need to be an expert.

And though it's not strictly
required for this course
you may want to learn about Figma
before you build your own application
with AWS Amplify Studio.

We'll be building a
note taking application
which has the following features.
The notes are all listed on the homepage.

You're able to create,
update, and delete notes.

Users are able to sign in,
create accounts, and sign out.

And users are only able to view
and modify their own notes.

We'll also deploy the front and
back end of the application.
The final app looks like this.
You have notes listed on the page.
You can update and delete notes,
and you can also create new ones.
I'll sign out,

and then you can sign back
in or create an account.
